Paper.Title: Using the Web to Overcome Data Sparseness

Section.Paragraph: This paper shows that the web can be employed to obtain frequencies for bigrams that are unseen in a given corpus. We describe a method for retrieving counts for adjective-noun, noun-noun, and verb-object bigrams from the web by querying a search engine. We evaluate this method by demonstrating that web frequencies and correlate with frequencies obtained from a carefully edited, balanced corpus.
We also perform a task-based evaluation, showing that web frequencies can reliably predict human plausibility judgments.
